intro: Dissochaeta annulata var. setosa, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, hairy leaves that are lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in terminal umbels, producing a distinctive appearance. The species is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in moist to dry conditions.
